Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: The upper and lower portions in common type of bi-focal lenses are respectively
options: both concave of different focal lengths
both convex of different focal lengths
Physics (Optics).explanation: The upper and lower portions in common type of bifocal lenses are concave and convex respectively.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: In the phenomenon of dispersion of light, the light wave of shortest wavelength is
options: slowed down and refracted the most
slowed down and refracted the least
Physics (Optics).answer: slowed down and refracted the most
Physics (Optics).explanation: Short wavelength is slowed down and refracted the most

Physics (Electricity).subject: Physics (Electricity)
Physics (Electricity).question: Tungsten is used for the construction of filament in electric bulb because of its
Physics (Electricity).explanation: Tungsten has the highest melting point and lowest vapour pressure of all metals.

Physics (Electricity).subject: Physics (Electricity)
Physics (Electricity).question: Inactive Nitrogen and Argon gases are usually used in electric bulbs in order to
options: increase the intensity of light emitted
increase the life of the filament
make the production of bulb economical
Physics (Electricity).answer: increase the life of the filament
Physics (Electricity).explanation: The inert gas within the bulb prevents the filament from evaporating.Thus it increases the life of the filament.

Physics (Waves & Sound).subject: Physics (Waves & Sound)
Physics (Waves & Sound).question: An oscilloscope is an instrument which allows us to see waves produced by
Physics (Waves & Sound).explanation: Oscilloscope is an instrument which allows us to see waves produced by sound. The microphone can then pick up the sound and convert it to an electrical signal which can be displayed on the oscilloscope.

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: The distribution of electrons into different orbits of an atom, as suggested by Bohr; is
options: 2 electrons in the K-orbit, 6 electrons in the L-orbit, 18 electrons in the M-orbit
2 electrons in the K-orbit, 8 electrons in the L-orbit, 32 electrons in the M-orbit
2 electrons in the K-orbit, 8 electrons in the L-orbit, 18 electrons in the M-orbit
2 electrons in the K-orbit, 8 electrons in the L-orbit, 16 electrons in the M-orbit
Physics (Modern Physics).answer: 2 electrons in the K-orbit, 8 electrons in the L-orbit, 18 electrons in the M-orbit
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: Maximum n of electrons in K,L, M and N is 2, 8, 18 and 32 respectively.

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: Carbon or Graphite rods are used in atomic reactors as moderators for sustained nuclear chain reaction through nuclear fission process. In this process
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: Moderators like carbon and Graphite are used for slowing down the neutrons in a nuclear reactor. Neutrons from fission have very high speeds and must be slowed greatly by "moderation" to maintain the chain reaction.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: The distance-time graph for an object is shown above. Which one of the following statements holds true for this object ?
options: The object is moving with uniform speed
The object is having non-linear motion
The object is moving with non-uniform speed

Physics (Oscillations & Waves).subject: Physics (Oscillations & Waves)
Physics (Oscillations & Waves).question: For a harmonic oscillator, the graph between momentum p and displacement q would come out as

Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).subject: Chemistry (Chemical Reactions)
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).question: Which one of the following gases is supporter of combustion?
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).explanation: Oxygen is supporter of combustion. Though it is not combustible. Combustion is an oxidation process and this cannot occur without the presence of oxygen.

Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).subject: Chemistry (Chemical Reactions)
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).question: Iron sheet kept in moist air covered with rust. Rust is
options: a mixture of iron and dust
a mixture of iron, oxygen and water
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).explanation:
Rust is an iron oxide formed by the redox reaction of iron and oxygen in the presence of water or air moisture
4Fe+2O2 + xH2O â€”> 2Fe2O3.xH2O
Fromair Hydrated iron oxide (rust)
Hence rust is a compound.

Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).subject: Chemistry (Chemical Reactions)
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).question: When carbon dioxide is passed through lime water, the solution turns milky, but, on prolonged passage, the solution turns clear. This is because
options: the calcium carbonate formed initially is converted to soluble calcium bicarbonate on passage of more carbon dioxide
the reaction is reversible and lime water is regenerated
the calcium bicarbonate formed initially is converted to soluble calcium carbonate on passage of more carbon dioxide
the initially formed insoluble compound is soluble in carbonic acid .
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).answer: the calcium carbonate formed initially is converted to soluble calcium bicarbonate on passage of more carbon dioxide
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).explanation: Lime water is actually Ca(OH)2. When it reacts with CO2, insoluble CaCO3 is formed which turns solution milky. When excess CO2 is added, CaCO3 reacts with water and CO2 to form Calcium bicarbonate which is soluble. That is why the solution clears out.

Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).subject: Chemistry (Chemical Reactions)
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).question: Which one among the following is an example of chemical change ?
options: The melting of an ice cube
Attraction of an iron nail to a magnet
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).explanation: Frying an egg involves a chemical change. The heat in the frying process gives energy to the egg's molecules and brings about a permanent change in the substance.

Physics (Thermal Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Thermal Properties of Matter)
Physics (Thermal Properties of Matter).question: A metal screw top on a glass bottle which appears to be stuck could be opened by using the fact that
options: the metal expands more than the glass when both are heated
the metal and glass expand identically when heated
Both metal and glass shrink when cooled
Physics (Thermal Properties of Matter).answer: the metal expands more than the glass when both are heated
Physics (Thermal Properties of Matter).explanation: Both metal and glass expand when heated. Here glass is a non-metal. Metal expands more than non-metal due to temperature change.

Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).question: Which of the following are the two main constituents of granite?
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).explanation: Silica and aluminium are the two main constituents of granite. Granite contains 70-77% of silica and 11-13% of aluminium in the form of (Al2O3).

Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).question: Which of the following is a good lubricant ?
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).explanation: Graphite and graphite powder are a naturally occurring form of carbon which serves as an industrial lubricant.

Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).question: The form of carbon known as graphite
options: contains a higher percentage of carbon than diamond
is a better electrical conductor than diamond
has equal carbon-to-carbon distances in all directions
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).answer: is a better electrical conductor than diamond
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).explanation: Graphite is a very good conductor, while diamond has a very low electrical conductivity.

Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).question: Chromium oxide in paints makes the colour of paint
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).explanation: Chromium oxide in paints makes the colour of paint green.

Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry)
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).question:
Consider the following statements.
Statement I : Clay layers are poor aquifers.
Statement II : The inter-particle space of clay minerals is the least.
Select the correct answer using the codes given below :
options: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I
Both the statements are individually true but Statement II is not the correct explanation of Statement I
Statement I is true but Statement II is false
Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).answer: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).explanation: An aquifer is an underground layer of water bearing rock. Water bearing rocks are permeable i.e., they have opening that liquids and gases can pass through. But clay layers are poor aquifers. Clay minerals are dense, impermeable material and act as an 'aquifuge' i.e., a layer of material that is almost impenetrable to water.

Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry)
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).question: Nitric oxide pollution can lead to all of the following, except
options: bronchitis related respiratory problems in human
production of corrosive gases through photochemical reaction
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).explanation: Silicosis in human is lung disease caused by inhalation of crystalline sillica-dust.

Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Organic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).question: Addition of ethylene dibromide to petrol
options: increases the octane number of fuel
removes the sulphur compound in petrol
serves as a substitute of tetraethyl lead
Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).explanation: It helps in elimination of lead oxide.

Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Organic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).question: The main constituent of Gobar gas is
Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).explanation: Biogas is primarily methane (CH4) and carbon dioxide (CO2) and may have small amounts of hydrogen sulphide (H2S), moisture and siloxanes.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question:
Which of the following statements is/are correct?
1. Amnion contains fluid.
2. Ultrasound scan can detect the sex of an embryo.
Select the correct answer using the codes given below
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation:
Amnion is a membrane, filled with fluid, closely covers the embryo.
The sex of the embryo may be determined by ultrasound as early as 11 weeks gestation.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question:
Which of the statements given below are correct?
1. A person having blood group 'A' can donate blood to persons having blood group 'A' and blood group 'AB'.
2. A person having blood group 'AB' can donate blood to persons having blood groups 'A', 'B', 'AB' or 'O'.
3. A person with blood group 'O' can donate blood to persons having any blood group.
4. A person with blood group 'O' can receive blood from the person of any of the blood groups.
Select the correct answer using the code given below :
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: A person with AB blood group can receive blood from any group but cannot donate blood to any group other than AB. O individual can receive blood only from a group of O individual but can donate blood to all groups.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: Which one among the following is the correct pathway for the elimination of urine ?
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: The kidneys filter metabolic wastes, excess ions, and chemicals from the blood to form urine. The ureters are a pair of tubes that carry urine from the kidneys to the urinary bladder. The urethra is the tube through which urine passes from the bladder to the exterior of the body.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question:
Which of the following statements is/are correct ?
1. Coronary artery supplies blood to heart muscles.
2. Pulmonary vein supplies blood to lungs.
3. Hepatic artery supplies blood to kidneys.
4. Renal vein supplies blood to kidneys.
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: The coronary arteries deliver blood to the heart muscle, providing a continuous supply of oxygen and nutrients needed for it to stay healthy and function normally. The pulmonary veins receive oxygenated blood from the lungs and drain into the left atrium of the heart.The Hepatic artery supplies oxygen-rich blood to the liver, pylorus, pancreas, and duodenum. The renal arteries carry a large portion of total blood flow to the kidneys.

Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts).subject: Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts)
Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts).question:
Which of the following solutions will not change the colour of blue litmus paper to red?
1. Acid solution 2. Base solution
3. Common salt solution
Select the correct answer using the codes given below
Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts).explanation: The blue litmus paper turns red in acidic solution and blue in basic solution. The neutral solution does not affect the litmus paper. Now since common salt solution is neutral hence do not show any colour change on litmus paper.

Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts).subject: Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts)
Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts).question: Which of the following is not correct about Baking Soda?
options: It is used in soda acid fire extinguisher
It is added for faster cooking.
It neutralizes excess acid in the stomach
Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts).explanation: Rest of the statements are true.

Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts).subject: Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts)
Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts).question:
Statement I : During indigestion, milk of magnesia is taken to get rid of pain in the stomach.
Statement II : Milk of magnesia is a base and it neutralizes the excess acid in the stomach.
options: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I
Both the statements are individually true but Statement II is not the correct explanation of Statement I
Statement I is true but Statement II is false
Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts).answer: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I
Chemistry (Acids, Bases & Salts).explanation: Milk of magnesia (magnesium hydroxide) is most commonly found as a liquid. The magnesium in the liquid can both neutralize excess stomach acid to treat indigestion.

Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Applied Chemistry)
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).question: Date of manufacture of food items fried in oil should be checked before buying because oils become rancid due to
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).explanation: Oil become rancid due to oxidation. Oil contains fatty acid which react in presence of oxygen and become rancid. Rancid oil is a major source of destructive free radicals in our diet.

Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry)
Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry).question: Bagasse, a by-product of sugar manufacturing industry, is used for the production of
Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry).explanation: Bagasse is sugarcane fibre waste left after juice extraction.It is used for the production of paper.

Chemistry (Nuclear Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Nuclear Chemistry)
Chemistry (Nuclear Chemistry).question: In Tritium (T), the number of protons (P) and neutrons (N) respectively are
Chemistry (Nuclear Chemistry).explanation: Tritium is a radioactive isotope of hydrogen. The nucleus of tritium contains one proton and two neutrons.

Biology (Diseases).subject: Biology (Diseases)
Biology (Diseases).question: Which one among the following is the generic name of the causal organism of Elephantiasis ?
Biology (Diseases).explanation: Elephantiasis is a symptom of a variety of diseases, where parts of a person's body swell to massive proportions. It is caused by a number of parasitic worms, particularly Wuchereria bancrofti.

Biology (Biochemistry).subject: Biology (Biochemistry)
Biology (Biochemistry).question: Which one among the following statements is not correct?
options: Milk is a rich source of Vitamin A
Cereals are very poor source of carbohydrates
Vegetables are rich source of minerals
Biology (Biochemistry).answer: Cereals are very poor source of carbohydrates
Biology (Biochemistry).explanation: Cereals are good source of carbohydrate.

Biology (Cell Biology).subject: Biology (Cell Biology)
Biology (Cell Biology).question: Which of the following parts are found in both plant and animal cells ?
Biology (Cell Biology).explanation: Cell Membrane, Cytoplasm and Nucleus are found in both plant and animal cells.

Biology (Ecology & Environment).subject: Biology (Ecology & Environment)
Biology (Ecology & Environment).question: Which one of the following types of pesticides is convenient to control stored grain pests ?
Biology (Ecology & Environment).explanation: Fumigants are used to penetrate and remain in the container for long enough to kill all stages of insects present in stores grains.

Biology (Zoology).subject: Biology (Zoology)
Biology (Zoology).question:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the code given below the Lists:
List-I (Animal)
A. Ascaris
B. Malarial parasite
C. Housefly
D. Cow
List-II (Phyla)
1. Mammalia
2. Arthropoda
3. Nematoda
4. Protozoa
Codes:
A B C D
Biology (Zoology).explanation:
The correct match is as follows:
Ascaris - Nematoda
Malarial parasite - Protozoa
Housefly - Arthropoda
Cow - Mammalia

Biology (Zoology).subject: Biology (Zoology)
Biology (Zoology).question: Which one among the following cattle breed produces highest amount of milk ?
Biology (Zoology).explanation: Holstein Friesians are world's highest-production dairy animals. They are found mostly in Netherlands/Germany.

Biology (Botany).subject: Biology (Botany)
Biology (Botany).question: Which one among the following pairs is not correctly matched ?
options: Sandal wood plant : Partial root parasite
